org.openimaj.data

Interface DataSource<DATATYPE>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATATYPE - the data type which can be returned
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<DATATYPE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataSource, AbstractMultiListDataSource, ArrayBackedDataSource, ByteArrayBackedDataSource, DoubleArrayBackedDataSource, FloatArrayBackedDataSource, IndexedViewDataSource, IntArrayBackedDataSource, LocalFeatureListDataSource, LongArrayBackedDataSource, RandomSampleDataSource, SampleBatchByteDataSource, SampleBatchIntDataSource, ShortArrayBackedDataSource

    public interface DataSource<DATATYPE>
extends Iterable<DATATYPE>
    A source which returns data of type DATATYPE. Classes which implement this interface must support random access to rows as well as the ability to get random subsets of data.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DATATYPE[] createTemporaryArray(int size)
      Create a temporary array suitable for use with the getRandomRows(Object[]) and getData(int, int, Object[]) methods.

      Get the data for a given row
      void getData(int startRow, int stopRow, DATATYPE[] data)
      Get data between given rows.
      void getRandomRows(DATATYPE[] data)

      int size() 

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        void getData(int startRow,
             int stopRow,
             DATATYPE[] data)
        Get data between given rows. startRow must be > 0, stopRow must be smaller than size(). data is guaranteed to have (stopRow - startRow) valid entries
        Parameters:
        startRow - where to start (inclusive)
        stopRow - where to stop (exclusive)
        data - the array to fill

      • getData

        DATATYPE getData(int row)
        Get the data for a given row
        Parameters:
        row - the row number
        Returns:
        the data for the row

      • numDimensions

        int numDimensions()
        Returns:
        Number of dimensions of each data point

      • getRandomRows

        void getRandomRows(DATATYPE[] data)
        Parameters:
        data - a random set of data. This array is guaranteed to be filled.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns:
        the number of data points

      • createTemporaryArray

        DATATYPE[] createTemporaryArray(int size)
        Create a temporary array suitable for use with the getRandomRows(Object[]) and getData(int, int, Object[]) methods.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the array
        Returns:
        the array
